articles.title: Google to pay $6.126b after losing challenge against EU antitrust decision, wins 5 per cent fine cut - ABC News
articles.description: The General Court largely confirmed the European Commission's 2018 decision but trimmed Google's fine by 5 per cent to $6.126 billion because it disagreed with the EU competition enforcer on one point.
articles.content: Google has suffered its second setback in less than a year as Europe's top court agreed with EU antitrust regulators that it had abused its dominance, but trimmed the fine by 5 per cent because of a … [+3549 chars]

articles.title: Google loses challenge against EU antitrust decision, other probes loom - Reuters
articles.description: Google suffered one of its biggest setbacks on Wednesday when a top European court fined it 4.125 billion euros ($4.13 billion) for using its Android mobile operating system to thwart rivals, offering a precedent for other regulators to ratchet up pressure.
